title: Authorizes the personal appearance of crime victims at the parole hearings of the offender
summary: Requires that the district attorney inform the victim of a crime of such victim's right to personally or by representative appear, where the crime victim is deceased or is mentally or physically incapacitated, and be heard at the defendant's parole hearing; establishes qualifications to be a crime victim's representative.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the criminal procedure law and the executive law, in relation to appearance of a victim at parole hearings
